metadata.name: Blue Archive Stellaris Mod - Fixed Dictionary
metadata.description: A comprehensive glossary of all extracted terms (characters, schools, clubs, concepts, etc.) from the mod's localization files. Fixed and cleaned version.

metadata.remarks: One of the three largest academies in Kivotos...
One of the three largest academies in Kivotos, rival to Trinity.

translations.ja: ミレニアムサイエンススクール

metadata.remarks: One of the three largest academies in Kivotos, focused on science and technology.
Gehenna Academy's disciplinary committee, led by Sorasaki Hina.
A club in Gehenna that undertakes any job for money, led by Rikuhachima Aru.
President of the Abydos Foreclosure Task Force. Former Vice President of the Abydos Student Council.
Head of the Gehenna Prefect Team.
Personal trait of Okusora Ayane.
Personal trait of Takanashi Hoshino. Note: This is a mod-specific concept, translations are based on context.
A club in Gehenna Academy dedicated to the study and pursuit of all kinds of food.
A club in Gehenna Academy focused on finding and developing hot springs, often with explosive methods.
A club in Trinity General School that enjoys eating and discussing sweets.
The primary student policing body of Trinity General School.
The main setting of Blue Archive, a massive academy city.
One of the three hosts of the Tea Party in Trinity. Mentioned in dialogue.
The treasurer of Millennium's student council, Seminar. Mentioned in dialogue.
A club in Trinity for students who need remedial lessons.
The highest governing body in Kivotos, currently missing its president.
One of the three hosts of the Tea Party in Trinity. Mentioned in dialogue.
One of the three hosts of the Tea Party in Trinity. Mentioned in dialogue.
Refers to a student belonging to the Arius Branch School.
Refers to a student belonging to the Valkyrie Police School.

translations.ja: 部活のスポンサー額設定

metadata.remarks: Mod-specific policy name. JA/KO translations are contextual.
The player's role in Blue Archive.
The glowing ring above a student's head, signifying their special status.
Character-specific fragments used for recruitment and unlocking Mystic Rarity.
The main currency in Blue Archive.
Out-of-Place Artifacts. Materials used for skill upgrades.
Refers to the Sensei from an alternate, failed timeline. Used here as a concept for a council agenda.
A popular bird-like character mascot in Kivotos, adored by Hifumi.
Stands for District of Union. A central district in Kivotos.
Mod-specific unit name. JA/KO translations are contextual.
The premium currency in Blue Archive, described here as a unique material for construction.

translations.ja: 自動居住ステーション

metadata.remarks: Mod-specific concept. Describes automated facilities built using Pyroxenes. JA/KO translations are contextual.
Mod-specific name for an Ascension Perk tree. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A student from the Game Development Department, found dormant in the ruins. Her true nature is a central plot point.
The administrator AI of the Nameless Priests' ark, connected to Aris.
A mysterious organization of occultists who are primary antagonists in the story.
The flagship controlled by Aris during the mid-game crisis event.
The giant mech created by the Kaitenrangers. The fleet in the event is named after it.
Mod-specific fleet name, associated with Aris. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A supernatural, corrupting force that threatens Kivotos by inverting the sacred into the profane.
A pantheon of false gods worshiped by Gematria.
A peace treaty between Trinity General School and Gehenna Academy, a central plot arc in the main story.
A central administrative tower in Kivotos that controls access to the city's infrastructure.
The missing leader of Kivotos who summoned Sensei.
Chief administrator of the General Student Council, currently acting as its head.
Mod-specific concept, likely a corrupted version of the Sanctum Tower. JA/KO translations are contextual.
Mod-specific enemy unit. JA/KO translations are contextual.
The mysterious tablet given to Sensei by the GSC President, containing the main OS Arona.
The main OS and AI assistant residing in the Shittim Chest.
The OS from the alternate timeline Sensei's (Phrenapates) Shittim Chest, who later cohabits with Arona.
Sensei's credit card, capable of performing miraculous feats at a cost.
A recurring enemy type in Kivotos, often depicted with numbered masks. Famously associated with Abydos students.
A placeholder name or mod-specific concept found in the event file ('Axium的留言'). JA/KO translations are contextual.
The librarian of Trinity's Library Committee. Initiator of the Halo research project in this event.
Mod-specific technology and event path related to Halo research. JA/KO translations are contextual.
The final stage or name of the Ascension Perk related to the Kivotos Chronicle.
The library in Trinity, managed by the Library Committee.

translations.ja: アトラ・ハシースの箱舟

metadata.remarks: A key location or superweapon in the story, referenced in a modifier. The name refers to the hero of the Akkadian flood myth.

translations.ja: プロジェクト・クレードル

metadata.remarks: A mod-specific project name mentioned in a modifier. JA/KO translations are contextual.
Latin for 'Lamb of God'. A mod-specific modifier name.
Latin for 'Glory to the Father'. A mod-specific modifier name.
Mod-specific pop job that produces research. JA/KO translations are contextual.

translations.ja: キヴォトス郊外労働者

metadata.remarks: Mod-specific pop job that produces basic resources (Energy, Minerals, Food). JA/KO translations are contextual.

translations.ja: キヴォトス工業技術者

metadata.remarks: Mod-specific pop job related to industrial output. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A core mod-specific mechanic representing a school's unique philosophy or policy. JA/KO translations are contextual.
Shanhaijing's student council, led by Ryuuge Kisaki.
An organization in Shanhaijing that provides child care and education, led by Sunohara Shun.
A merchant federation in Shanhaijing, led by Akeshiro Rumi.
A mod-specific event chain and trait related to Takanashi Hoshino. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A mod-specific original character, the antagonist of the 'Mining Incident' event chain.
An easter egg character referencing the protagonist from the game 'Needy Streamer Overload'.
Attack type effective against Light Armour.
Attack type effective against Heavy Armour.
Attack type effective against Special Armour.
Armour type weak against Explosive attacks.
Armour type weak against Piercing attacks.
Armour type weak against Mystic attacks.
A Total Assault Boss.
A Total Assault Boss.
A Total Assault Boss.
A Total Assault Boss, a giant version of Peroro.
A squad of four students from the now-defunct SRT Special Academy.
The name of the event chain for the RABBIT Squad raid. This is a reference to a creature from the film 'Monty Python and the Holy Grail'.
The department within the General Student Council responsible for issuing the SRT school closure order.
A sentient pancake monster created by Juri's cooking during a crisis event. JA/KO translations are contextual ('Pancake-chan').
The primary species name for the player's empire in the mod.
A robotic species type within the mod, a pun on 'Hime' (Princess) and robot. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A unique government type for the Kivotos civilization in the mod. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A personality for a Fallen Empire in the mod. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A mod-specific anomaly type. JA/KO translations are contextual.
A mod-specific archaeological site. JA/KO translations are contextual.
